The M24R is both an authentic piece of American military history, and also a superbly accurate target rifle.  The M24 was the first dedicated sniper rifle system designed and developed for use by the US military.  It was selected over other rifle models from both Winchester and Steyr in 1987. The M24 is based on Remington's time-proven Model 700 action, which itself was based on the legendary Mauser Model 98.  It is a manually operated bolt action, with an internal 5 round magazine.  It is fitted with a 24" long extra-heavy barrel, featuring Remington's 5R rifling (very precisely cut and with slightly rounded edges for maximum bullet stability). During the M24E1/XM2010 proposal preparation process, the Remington team realized that essentially almost all of the parts of the M24 were going to be removed and discarded. The proposal team recognized an opportunity and decided to offer the Government a contract price reduction for a complete set of serviceable parts if Remington would be allowed to resell these parts in the form of complete sniper systems on the commercial firearms & collector market.
